Position Summary

At Daktronics, you'll be part of something extraordinary. We design, engineer, manufacture, and support bold, eye-catching digital LED display technology and audio systems that captivate audiences worldwide. Our products bring excitement to professional, college, and high school games, attract customers for businesses globally, and provide direction for people as they travel, work, and play.

Why Choose Daktronics?

  • Innovative Products: Create cutting-edge digital displays seen globally.
  • Stable Schedule: Enjoy a consistent work schedule with no rotating shifts.
  • Clean Environment: Work in a clean, safe, organized, and well-lit environment.
  • Team Atmosphere: Join a supportive and collaborative team.
  • Variety and Growth: Engage in diverse tasks with opportunities for learning and development.
  • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from competitive pay and meaningful benefits.

When will I work?

  • 4/10s Schedule, Primary Schedule – The primary work hours for this position are 4:30pm – 3:00am, Monday through Thursday, with overtime required as needed.

Where is this opportunity located?

Position located in Brookings, South Dakota in our HSPR department.

 

What will the work look like for me?

  • A Metal Machine Operator manufactures sheet metal assemblies and welded extruded frames. 
  • Setup and operate a variety of machines (for example metal punch, press brake, saw, CNC mill). Operate some computer/controlled machines. Basic layout. Use precision measuring instruments, calipers square, etc. 
  • Safely and responsibly use tools including air driven power manual and other tools (for example drills and riveting guns). 
  • Follow written instructions and blueprints. Record work done. Perform basic math calculations. 
  • Accurately and consistently complete quality work in a timely manner. Inspect own work. Quickly learn new tasks. Accurately and consistently complete repetitive tasks. 
  • Work effectively as a team member, work with little supervision, help when and where needed, make suggestions for process and product improvement, communicate effectively with team members. Follow company guidelines. 
  • Work scheduled hours. Work overtime when necessary. 
  • Willing to work in any manufacturing department through flexibility. 
  • Perform other duties as needed to meet customer expectations. 
  • Program metal fabrication machines through automated computer equipment. 

What are the pay and perks:

Starting Pay: $19.00/Hr. + $3.00/ Hr. Skill Increment and $2.00/Hr. Shift Increment.

Qualifications

To be considered for Metal Machine Operator – Day Shift, we require the following:

  • High school diploma or GED required.  
  • Current or previous successful metal machine operation experience preferred.  
  • Good communication skills.   
  • Ability to learn quickly. 
  • Ability to successfully participate as a member of a team. 
  • Ability to work with minimum supervision. 
  • Regularly and reliably work the scheduled hours. Ability to work overtime when workload requires. 
  • Wear all proper protective equipment as required in work area in accordance with Daktronics Safety Policy and OSHA standards. Items may include safety glasses, safety shoes/boots, hearing protection, and electrostatic discharge wear. 
  • Physical requirements include the ability to: 
    • Distinguish and identify color. 
    • Read fine print. 
    • Work with odors (solder, paint, solvent, or general manufacturing odor). 
    • Lift and carry heavy (up to 50 lbs.) and/or awkward items. 
    • Stand or sit for the full shift. 
    • Have full range of motion (including but not limited to bending and lifting) required to perform the job function. 
    • Maintain steady hand-eye coordination. 
    • Reach in all directions and in potentially awkward positions. 
  • Ability to travel by air and ground. Valid driver’s license. Must be able to meet and maintain Daktronics Qualified Driver status. Motor vehicle records will be checked.
  • Fluent in English, written and verbal. 
  • Applicants must be 18 years of age or older. 
  • Daktronics does not sponsor, renew, or extend immigration visas for this position. 

Ready to make an impact? Be part of a company that values your contributions and offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment. Learn more about Daktronics and take the next step in your manufacturing career with us!

Daktronics is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Overview

 

 

 

NOW HIRING Drivers

Full Time & Part Time Available!

Great Opportunity for anyone looking for a rewarding career in Transportation.

 

Enjoy the following additional benefits:

  • Weekday daylight hours
  • Industry leading wages
  • Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • Company Uniforms
  • Free CPR & First Aid Certification
  • Free DOT Physical
  • Continuing Education and Free Certifications

*Candidates must be 25 years old or older, with a high school diploma or GED and a valid Pennsylvania driver’s license. Successful candidates must be able to pass an (MVR) motor vehicle record check.
